document.heading: Vital Records Adoptive Birth Registration Amendment Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-101, the “Vital Records Adoptive Birth Registration Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-192, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 4, 1992, and March 3, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 23, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-173 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-101 became effective on May 21, 1992.
